title: Mmm-Mmm Better Brownies Recipe
description: A brownie recipe with oil, cocoa powder, flour, and eggs that's easy to make. Chopped walnuts add a nice crunch factor to this very chocolaty treat!

Recipes Mmm-Mmm Better Brownies 4.5 (1,866) 1,577 Reviews 135 Photos This brownie recipe with oil makes the best brownies in the world in my opinion. Try them, I think you'll agree! You can use melted butter instead of vegetable oil if you prefer. Submitted by Sarah Updated on May 31, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 135 135 135 135 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 16 brownies Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings 1 cup white sugar ¬Ω cup vegetable oil 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 eggs ¬Ω cup all-purpose flour ‚Öì cup unsweetened cocoa powder ¬º teaspoon baking powder ¬º teaspoon salt ¬Ω cup chopped walnuts (Optional) Directions Gather ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch square baking pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix sugar, oil, and vanilla together in a medium bowl; beat in eggs until well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix flour, cocoa, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl; gradually stir into egg mixture until well blended. Stir in walnuts. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until the brownie begins to pull away from the edges of the pan, about 20 to 25 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Let cool on a wire rack before cutting into 16 squares. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,807 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 161 Calories 10g Fat 17g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 161 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 13% Saturated Fat 2g 8% Cholesterol 23mg 8% Sodium 53mg 2% Total Carbohydrate 17g 6% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 13g Protein 2g 4% Calcium 14mg 1% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 57mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Mmm-Mmm Better Brownies 01 of 135 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 135 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 04/11/2025 Did not work Missing ingredients Missing steps Thought the batter wasn't cooking, and then realized it was deep frying from all the oil. I doubled the recipie, and it looked like sugar and eggs mixed together, and this was after the dry ingredients were added. I tried to save it by adding more oil and water. It didn't work. Now I have a clump of sugar and egg looking mixture that's burning hot, and rock hard like glass candy, but chocolate. And it doesn't taste like chocolate. Not sure if the person who made this is blind, or has no sense of taste, but I wouldn't even feed this to the stray raccoons. She doesn't need to be baking or cooking ANYTHING. 03 of 135 Photo by¬† Vio 04/25/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite I halved the recipe (this makes like enough for only 2 people). I also reduced the sugar by a little but I assure you it will be sweet enough.In grams, this was my converted 1/2 recipe (if you want full then just double).75g white sugar,50g oil oil (or 4 tbsp),1/2 tsp vanilla extract,1 egg,30g flour,16g cocoa powder,1/8 tsp salt,1/8 tsp baking powder,I baked at 160 degrees celcius for 26 minutes then let it cool. 04 of 135 Photo by¬† YellowSage5338 01/13/2024 Not gunna lie it‚Äôs was perfect I was scceptical at first cause it had no brown sugar but they were delicious 05 of 135 Photo by¬† Mastura Abdul Rahman 01/01/2023 My girls love it!!.. so easy to make...Thank you for the recipe...üòäüòä 06 of 135 Photo by¬† TwistyBay4629 07/07/2022 07 of 135 Photo by¬† Kathy Lean Cuisine 02/14/2022 Better than a box mix. And just as fast. 08 of 135 Photo by¬† Rachael Egunjobi 05/23/2021 It is the best brownie . I and my family really enjoyed it .Instead of walnuts , I used some matched peanuts and it was delicious 09 of 135 Photo by¬† Kim 02/28/2021 Spongey and weird. Unpleasant. I'll still eat it because it's a waste otherwise. 10 of 135 Photo by¬† Selena Salisbury 02/26/2021 Yummy lol be it. Never make a box mix again. So easy. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Absolutely Best Brownies 679 Ratings Sand Art Brownies 163 Ratings Scrumptious Frosted Fudgy Brownies 166 Ratings Pecan Pie Bars 673 Ratings Quick and Easy Brownies 2,255 Ratings Zucchini Brownies 2,992 Ratings Vegan Brownies 963 Ratings Chewy Peanut Butter Brownies 1,055 Ratings Oatmeal Peanut Butter Cookies 3,153 Ratings The Ultimate Brownie 182 Ratings Double-Frosted Brownies 1 Rating Cranberry Pistachio Biscotti 1,872 Ratings Super Fudge Brownies 7 Ratings Jeanine's Decadent Brownies 8 Ratings Peanut Butter Brownies II 81 Ratings Gooey Brownies 4 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
